results.title: The Widening net 1945-
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788”.
Covers the period from 1945 to 1985. Shows how the enormous intake of migrants from Britain, Western Europe and the ;Mediterranean alter the face of Australia; and notes how from the early 1970’s, with a changing economy, recruitment fluctuates and then dies down. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

group.title: Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788

results.title: From gaol to gentry
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788”.
This film examines the period of Australian history covering 1788-1840. Depicts the struggle for survival of the first fleet; the transformation of the penal colony into a mecca for British free settlers with the advent of the wool industry; encroachment of the pastoral industry on Aboriginal communities with disastrous results and slowing of migration with economic slump of the 1840’s. Suitable for middle to upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Golden land: 1840s-1900
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788”.
This film examines the period of Australian history, 1840-1900, that included the Gold-rush years and the farming boom.

group.title: Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788

results.title: Growing pains
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788”.
One of a series of films that examines the history of immigration to Australia. This film covers the period 1901-1945 and looks at the effects that the depression and the two world wars had on immigration.

group.title: Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788

results.title: You keep juggling
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788”.
One of a series of films that examines the history of immigration to Australia. This film discusses the assimilation of different cultures. Migrants speak of their experience as young people assimilation in Australia. For many there has been the conflict of finding a balance of identity between their parent’s home country values and Australian values.

group.title: Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788

results.title: Foreigners
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788”.
One of a series of films that examines the history of immigration to Australia. In this film, “White Australians” give their opinions on the migrant influx, while Irish, Chinese, English and Turkish migrants relate instances of intolerance in Australia. They refer to situations of race, language or cultural difference and of economic pressure. In this film, social commentator Phillip Adams, academic Dinny O’Hearn and (former) RSL President Bruce Ruxton also make comments on matters relating to national identity.

results.title: Dance frame
results.creator_credit: Doris Chase and WNYC-TV (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance By Doris Chase”.
The fluid motion of a dancer is circumscribed by rectangular frames of various colours. Accompanied by electronic music by Joan La Barbara and choreographed by Sara Rudner.
